title: Technical Program Manager III, Embedded Software Development, Pixel
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. Work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in program management. Experience in embedded Systems Development.
preferred_qualifications: 5 years of experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects. Experience managing software development for consumer hardware products. Experience working with the Android ecosystem and development. Ability to work in a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment. Ability to prioritize when working on multiple tasks/projects. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence, collaborate, and deliver solutions in a changing environment.
responsibilities: Work with Software leads, Product Managers, cross-functional Hardware/software Technical Program Manager's and external partners to define and launch innovative new features. Define milestones and drive/lead engineering teams to identify, prioritize, and track tasks to completion. Drive external partners and internal teams to deliver features and bug fixes. Track and prioritize feature/surface/system development work from concept to launch. Identify risks and corresponding mitigation plans, and implement solutions.
